it.polimi.se2019.adrenalina.ui.text

Class BoardPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.adrenalina.ui.text.BoardPrinter

  • public final class BoardPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class used to print a game map in TUI. It consists of several methods which contribute to build a "print matrix". The print matrix is an array of rows; each row is an array of characters. For characters, String is used instead of char in order to include ANSI escape sequences for setting colors.

    • Method Detail

      • drawCorner

        private static void drawCorner(java.lang.String[][] map,
                               Square square,
                               CornerType cornerType)
        Generates the corner of a square and adds it to the print matrix. The corner style depends on the borders of the square:
        • no corner if there are no borders (BorderType is AIR);
        • a straight line if only one of the two borders exist;
        • an actual corner shape if both of the two borders exist.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to consider
        cornerType - the type of corner to draw

      • drawEdge

        private static void drawEdge(java.lang.String[][] map,
                             Square square,
                             Direction direction,
                             int pos)
        Generates the edge of a square in a certain direction and adds it to the print matrix. If the border of the square in that direction is a wall, the edge will be a straight line. If the square has no border in that direction (BorderType is AIR), no visible edge will be added. If the border of the square in that direction is a door, a special edge will be drawn consisting of five parts:
        • a straight line as a continuation of the wall;
        • the first corner of the door;
        • the empty part of the door;
        • the second corner of the door;
        • a straight line as a continuation of the wall.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to consider
        direction - the direction of the edge to draw
        pos - the current x or y position

      • drawAttributes

        private static void drawAttributes(java.lang.String[][] map,
                                   Square square)
        Generates the attributes inside a square and adds it to the print matrix. An attribute can be either a spawn point or an ammo card. The latter is represented with its three-letter code.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to consider
        See Also:
        AmmoCard.toString()

      • drawSquareCharacter

        private static void drawSquareCharacter(java.lang.String[][] map,
                                        Square square,
                                        int x,
                                        int y)
        Generates the characters that make up a square and adds them to the print matrix. It resorts to helper methods in order to draw corners and edges.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to consider
        x - the x coordinate of the character relative to the square
        y - the y coordinate of the character relative to the square

      • drawSquare

        private static void drawSquare(java.lang.String[][] map,
                               Square square)
        Generates a square and adds it to the print matrix. It uses helper methods to draw each character and the square's attributes.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to draw

        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        square - the square to consider

        Parameters:

      • printDashboardWeapons

        private static int printDashboardWeapons(java.lang.String[][] map,
                                         java.util.List<Weapon> weapons,
                                         java.lang.String playerColor,
                                         int weaponCount,
                                         int posX,
                                         int posY)
        Generates weapon icons and adds them to the print matrix. Returns the current X cursor position.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        weapons - the list of weapons to print - only includes unloaded weapons for enemies
        playerColor - the color of the player who owns the dashboard
        weaponCount - the total number of weapons to print
        posX - cursor X position
        posY - cursor Y position
        Returns:
        the updated cursor X position

      • printDashboardPowerUps

        private static int printDashboardPowerUps(java.lang.String[][] map,
                                          java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps,
                                          java.lang.String playerColor,
                                          int powerUpCount,
                                          int posX,
                                          int posY)
        Generates powerUps icons and adds them to the print matrix. Returns the current X cursor position.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix that will be updated
        powerUps - the list of powerUps to print - empty for enemies
        playerColor - the color of the player who owns the dashboard
        powerUpCount - the total number of powerUps to print
        posX - cursor X position
        posY - cursor Y position
        Returns:
        the updated cursor X position

      • drawDashboard

        private static void drawDashboard(java.lang.String[][] map,
                                  int num,
                                  Board board,
                                  Player player)
        Generates player dashboards and adds them to the print matrix.
        Parameters:
        map - the print matrix to be updated
        num - the ordinal number of the dashboard to be printed
        board - the game board
        player - the player who owns the dashboard
